title: Very weird spikes, in LoL only.
body:
So I've been consistently having lag spikes during league games, but it's not something that shows up in terms of ping, my ping will stay right around 25, and my framerate is either like 300 or 120 if I'm capping it.

What happens is, for maybe 2-10 seconds per spike, multiple times per game, all player movements become delayed and everyone starts slowly sliding and or rubberbanding around my screen. Spell animations do not play, but I CAN send spell commands, I just won't receive feedback on those commands until the spike has ended when all the animations of the lag period play all at once. I can sort of glean where everybody is generally speaking and health bars DO update throughought the hang time with only slight delay.

It makes it virtually impossible to play the game and I have zero issues in other games I'm playing right now such as Overwatch, WoW and Conan Exiles (aside from it's minor netcode and optimization issues).

I don't even know where to begin with this, I uninstalled and reinstalled, updated video drivers, I'm running an i5 4690k 1070gtx 16g ddr3 1600 a samsung evo 128g ssd and using a wireless AC adapter and router with 100M download and 15M upload. ISP is Cox communications out of Omaha, NE.

replies.body: Even with solid internet, It sounds like you could be having some pretty massive packet loss.  Even if your net is fine elsewhere, you can still have issues with specific servers like the game server or how your ISP routes to it.  Run a [log reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader) to give us an idea of what's happening.  Let me know what you find!
I have no clue why packet loss of all things didn't cross my mind. I ran your tool and found out I'm losing between 6-9% of packets on average with League.

Yeah same, was up to 10% packet loss on one test so I didn't bother posting the log, the hextech tool seemed to help, I'm wondering if QoS on my router is interfering as well, turning it off to test more. Maybe some games or server routes just deal with lag better than league right now but I think I just discovered that my USB ports are occasionally dropped my wireless card for a split second too, I'll have to do more research.

You're not crazy, I'm having the same issues, but with the ping also spiking. I'm not having ANY issues with other online multiplayer games, and League really doesn't take up any bandwidth to speak of. All my other apps are off so I'm not accidentally downloading something for steam, and no one else is at home. 

This has been happening for almost a week.
